headline.main: Paying the Price of a Fat Pet

docs.abstract: Many pet owners are finding that the extra pounds on a pudgy cat or dog can lead to severe - and costly - health problems.
docs.snippet: Many pet owners are finding that the extra pounds on a pudgy cat or dog can lead to severe - and costly - health problems.

docs.abstract: The third year of medical school has long been a pivotal point in training, but recently, the tradition of monthlong "rotations," a speed-dating introduction to the major disciplines of medicine and the issues patients face, has come under fire.
docs.snippet: The third year of medical school has long been a pivotal point in training, but recently, the tradition of monthlong "rotations," a speed-dating introduction to the major disciplines of medicine and the issues patients face, has come under fire.

docs.lead_paragraph: Disease outbreaks should be monitored in cities with a lot of air travel to London as the Summer Games approach, authors in The Lancet Infectious Diseases say.

headline.seo: Assessing Disease Risks at London’s Summer Olympics
headline.main: Friendship, Competition, Pathogens: Gauging an Outbreak at the Olympics
headline.print_headline: London: Friendship, Competition, Pathogens: Gauging an Outbreak at the Olympics

docs.abstract: Series of articles published in journal The Lancet Infectious Diseases explores the possibility that the 2012 Summer Olympics in London could trigger a global outbreak of disease.
docs.snippet: Disease outbreaks should be monitored in cities with a lot of air travel to London as the Summer Games approach, authors in The Lancet Infectious Diseases say.

docs.lead_paragraph: My 92-year-old aunt was a walking pharmacy, and a month ago it nearly killed her. The episode also cost the American medical system several hundred thousand dollars. Overmedication of the elderly is an all too common problem, a public health crisis that compromises the well-being of growing numbers of older adults. Many take fistfuls of prescription and over-the-counter medications on a regular basis, risking serious and sometimes fatal side effects and drug interactions.

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column warns that the overmedication of the elderly is a public health crisis that compromises the well-being of a growing number of older adults; says the most important precaution is to maintain a list of medications that is shown at each doctor visit. docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Breslow was a public health leader whose research gave mathematical proof to the notion that people can live longer and healthier by changing habits like smoking, diet and sleep.

headline.seo: Lester Breslow, Who Tied Good Habits to Longevity, Dies at 97
headline.main: Lester Breslow, Who Linked Healthy Habits and Long Life, Dies at 97
headline.print_headline: Lester Breslow, Who Linked Healthy Habits and Long Life, Dies at 97

docs.abstract: Dr Lester Breslow, public health leader whose research gave mathematical proof to the notion that people can live longer and healthier by changing habits like smoking, diet and sleep, dies at age 97.
docs.snippet: Dr. Breslow was a public health leader whose research gave mathematical proof to the notion that people can live longer and healthier by changing habits like smoking, diet and sleep.

docs.lead_paragraph: Can the MCAT identify that ethereal mix of scientist, humanist and spiritualist that makes a good doctor?

headline.main: Pre-Med’s New Priorities: Heart and Soul and Social Science

docs.abstract: Updated version of Medical College Admission Test features a substantial number of questions stressing the psychological and social aspects of medicine; goal of revision is to ensure that applicants with knowledge or people, as well as knowledge of science, have the best chance of being accepted to medical school.
docs.snippet: Can the MCAT identify that ethereal mix of scientist, humanist and spiritualist that makes a good doctor?
